About Halal Investments

What Makes an Investment Halal?

Halal investments avoid interest (riba), gambling (maysir), and uncertainty (gharar). They focus on asset-backed, profit-sharing, or ethical business models.

Common Halal Investment Options

  • Sukuk (Islamic bonds)
  • Islamic ETFs and mutual funds
  • Real estate investments
  • Commodity trading
  • Islamic banking products

Understanding Your Investment Options

Halal Investment Principles

  • Avoid interest-based investments (Riba)
  • No speculation or gambling (Gharar)
  • Ethical business practices required
  • Asset-backed investment structures

  • Focus on sustainable, ethical growth
  • Profit-sharing mechanisms (Mudarabah)
